channel.title: Seminars 1S/2024 on FEEC/UNICAMP IA382 - Seminar in Computer Engineering
channel.description: Recent content in Seminars 1S/2024 on FEEC/UNICAMP IA382 - Seminar in Computer Engineering

item.title: Advances in Holographic-Type Communications
item.description: Abstract # This talk will give an overview of video streaming technologies over telecommunication networks, while also taking the important evolution towards network softwarizaton into account.

item.title: Talking to Machines: A Practical introduction to Generative AI
item.description: Abstract # Generative AI is changing the way we interact with technology.

item.title: Next Generation Wireless for Time-critical Performance
item.description: Abstract # This talk will discuss recent developments on distributed computing and wireless communications to enable time-sensitive systems and applications, such as virtualized industrial automation, mobile robots, autonomous vehicles, and new immersive user experiences.

item.title: Latest trends on supporting an energy-efficient and resilient IoT-Edge-Cloud continuum
item.description: Abstract # The Edge to Cloud continuum defines the overall computing, network and data management required to handle services across an Internet of Things (IoT).

item.title: Revolutionizing Medical Imaging Diagnostics with AI​
item.description: Abstract # Medical imaging is an essential tool for diagnostics and health management.

item.title: IoT for Social Good​
item.description: Abstract # In this talk, I will describe some of our current projects on using Internet of Things (IoT) to tackle a range of applications that address timely societal problems including environment, climate and health.

item.title: To Offload or not to Offload?
item.description: Abstract # The slowdown of Moore’s Law, the end of Dennard’s scaling, and the rapid adoption of high-bandwidth links is creating new challenges when building high-performance end-host network stacks and when dealing with network function virtualization.
